question: Is it unIslamic to sue a group of kaffir who are harrasssing us and forbidding us to sit in front of our apt.? Plus scandals and other horrible things, bad notes, racial letters, ect.?
answer:
QUESTION
These American people are looking for reasons to harrass, kick us out, etc, by false complaints, accusations, telling us we have to sit in back of the house, and not in front, forbiding us from walking in area or sitting on grass. They say now we cannot be in front of the apartment. Our kids are not allowed to carry their birds in the cage. We are not allowed to have a chair in front, but they can. We are not allowed to do anything, but they all can. They leave racial notes on our car, windows, peek into iour windows and try to goad us into fight. They can't get a fight so they create false accusations. They are making all people hate us for no reason, some people listen, others do not. What can we do? We have not the money to move and do not want to move. Soheilah
ANSWER


Share:
If your complaints against the group in reference is legitimate and you have
no alternate way of addressing the complaints, you may seek refuge through
the legal system to alleviate your difficulties.

However, if the group in reference has any complaints against you or their
actions are based on your wrong doings, then you should rectify yourself and
conduct yourselves as Islam has advised us.

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
FATWA DEPT.
